subtitle: hi I'm Simon Jacobsen welcome to
meaningful Monday's where we answer your
personal questions the question for this
week is I suffer from self-loathing and
I do not feel valuable I grew up in a
home that beat me up all the time my
self-esteem got annihilated what can I
do about that my heart goes out to you
and to anyone else that has this type of
question not just for the pain that
you're experiencing but also for the
sadness are you not being allowed to be
aware of your birthright your god-given
right birth is God saying you matter
it's a line that I use in my book tour
de meaningful life in a line that I know
has helped many people you matter you're
indispensable no matter what kind of
parents you had no matter what happened
in your life no matter what experiences
even the worst cannot erase cannot
annihilate your true value so it's only
your awareness that has been damaged you
think you're not valuable that's why
it's doubly sad because it's one thing
to see a bird that is grounded and has
no wings it's another to see a bird that
has wings and doesn't all can fly so I
for one want to give you my vote of
confidence to know absolutely no matter
what happened in your life your soul
remains intact you have an indispensable
contribution to make and the whole world
is dependent on you think of yourself as
an indispensable musical note the music
cannot be complete without you playing
your note without you singing your song
this confidence is necessary in order to
rebuild what the kabbalists call a
breach of one's dignity when parents are
home an environment that's dysfunctional
beats you up and invalidates you
repeatedly
and makes you feel that you're worthless
to the point you begin to self loathe
what they're doing is extinguishing and
a conscious level the dignity that is
your birthright they don't destroy it
because it always remains in there
that's why we're bothered by it that
inner child always remains hungry always
remains calling and beckoning but what
they've done is in effect invalidates
this child so many times that the child
starts believing that they're worthless
and that of course is a tragedy so the
first step is is to get out of the line
of fire you can be an environment that
continues to be abusive to you have to
get yourself in an environment where you
hear the opposite people will believe in
you people who trust you people who
value you who validate you who love you
then you have to begin rebuilding that
dignity from within and this requires
very often connecting to some higher
calling connecting to God connecting to
your soul connecting to something that
transcends the message and the damage
that was done parents or home or other
environments that fed you their negative
connecting because you start seeing I
have a higher calling I have a purpose
in this world you start working at it
you start excelling at it which leads me
to the next step do things that you
excel at that you come home a day at the
end of a day and say I feel good about
what I did today now at the end of the
day saying look how bad I am look I just
confirming that self-loathing message
that I've always heard and finally
always remember and do this every
morning and every evening as an exercise
always remember I am a soul sent to this
earth with a mission to accomplish my
parents didn't give this to me my life
and my mission and they can't take it
away from me they may have deprived me
from oxygen or love or nurturing but
they did not take away my healthy sense
of pride and my healthy sense of purpose
you say this every morning when you wake
up and you say it every night when you
go to before you go to sleep steadily
consistently it begins to become a
message that starts feeding you
this is a great challenge of our times
because we often live in a world where
we are often measured by our value
people self-worth is often defined by
their net worth self-worth is often
defined by our looks by youth by our
output performance buying power all
kinds of superficial external things the
key thing to remember all those things
are temporary fixes instant
gratification short-term the bottom line
is what makes you valuable for ever and
ever is your inner self your soul that
was sent there for a purpose and a
mission because that's not dependent on
the whims and the vicissitudes of the
ups and downs of social acceptance
parental acceptance and peer pressure
and all the rest a marketing that sells
us all kinds of imagery and external
products telling you that if you have
this you'll be the valuable you'll have
that you'll be value you are valuable
because birth is God saying that you
matter thank you for watching I welcome
your personal questions please have a
meaningful week
